trans-unit.source: You can publish line-of-business (LOB) apps directly to enterprises for volume acquisition via the Windows Store for Business, without making the apps broadly available in the Store.
trans-unit.target: You can publish line-of-business (LOB) apps directly to enterprises for volume acquisition via the Windows Store for Business, without making the apps broadly available in the Store.

trans-unit.source: Distribute LOB apps to enterprises
trans-unit.target: Distribute LOB apps to enterprises

trans-unit.source: Distribute LOB apps to enterprises
trans-unit.target: Distribute LOB apps to enterprises

trans-unit.source: You can publish line-of-business (LOB) apps directly to enterprises for volume acquisition via the Windows Store for Business, without making the apps broadly available in the Store.
trans-unit.target: You can publish line-of-business (LOB) apps directly to enterprises for volume acquisition via the Windows Store for Business, without making the apps broadly available in the Store.

trans-unit.source: **Important** At this time, only free apps can be distributed exclusively to enterprises via the Store for Business.
trans-unit.target: **Important** At this time, only free apps can be distributed exclusively to enterprises via the Store for Business.

trans-unit.source: If you submit a paid app as LOB, it will be made available to the enterprise at a later date, once support is added for acquiring paid apps in volume.
trans-unit.target: If you submit a paid app as LOB, it will be made available to the enterprise at a later date, once support is added for acquiring paid apps in volume.

trans-unit.source: Setting up the enterprise association
trans-unit.target: Setting up the enterprise association

trans-unit.source: The first step in publishing LOB apps exclusively to an enterprise is to establish the association between your account and the enterprise’s private store.
trans-unit.target: The first step in publishing LOB apps exclusively to an enterprise is to establish the association between your account and the enterprise’s private store.

trans-unit.source: **Important** This association process must be initiated by the enterprise.
trans-unit.target: **Important** This association process must be initiated by the enterprise.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Working with line-of-business apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=698846).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Working with line-of-business apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=698846).

trans-unit.source: When an enterprise chooses to invite you to publish apps for their exclusive use, you’ll get an email that includes a link to confirm the association.
trans-unit.target: When an enterprise chooses to invite you to publish apps for their exclusive use, you’ll get an email that includes a link to confirm the association.

trans-unit.source: You can also confirm these associations by going to the **Enterprise associations** section of your **Account settings**.
trans-unit.target: You can also confirm these associations by going to the **Enterprise associations** section of your **Account settings**.

trans-unit.source: To confirm the association, click **Accept**.
trans-unit.target: To confirm the association, click **Accept**.

trans-unit.source: Your account will then be able to publish apps for that enterprise’s exclusive use.
trans-unit.target: Your account will then be able to publish apps for that enterprise’s exclusive use.

trans-unit.source: Submitting an LOB app
trans-unit.target: Submitting an LOB app

trans-unit.source: Once you’re ready to publish an app for an enterprise’s exclusive use, the process is similar to the app submission process.
trans-unit.target: Once you’re ready to publish an app for an enterprise’s exclusive use, the process is similar to the app submission process.

trans-unit.source: The app goes through the same certification process, and must comply with all [Windows Store Policies](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn764944).
trans-unit.target: The app goes through the same certification process, and must comply with all [Windows Store Policies](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn764944).

trans-unit.source: There are just two parts of the process that are different.
trans-unit.target: There are just two parts of the process that are different.

trans-unit.source: Distribution and visibility
trans-unit.target: Distribution and visibility

trans-unit.source: After you've set up an enterprise association, every time you submit an app you’ll see a drop-down box in the **Distribution and visibility** section of the submission’s **Pricing and availability** page.
trans-unit.target: After you've set up an enterprise association, every time you submit an app you’ll see a drop-down box in the **Distribution and visibility** section of the submission’s **Pricing and availability** page.

trans-unit.source: By default, this is set to **Retail distribution**.
trans-unit.target: By default, this is set to **Retail distribution**.

trans-unit.source: To make the app exclusive to an enterprise, you’ll need to choose **Line-of-business (LOB) distribution**.
trans-unit.target: To make the app exclusive to an enterprise, you’ll need to choose **Line-of-business (LOB) distribution**.

trans-unit.source: Once **Line-of-business (LOB) distribution** is selected, the usual **Distribution and visibility** options will be replaced with a list of the enterprises to which you can publish exclusive apps.
trans-unit.target: Once **Line-of-business (LOB) distribution** is selected, the usual **Distribution and visibility** options will be replaced with a list of the enterprises to which you can publish exclusive apps.

trans-unit.source: Select the enterprise(s) which should be able to get the app.
trans-unit.target: Select the enterprise(s) which should be able to get the app.

trans-unit.source: No one else will be able to access it.
trans-unit.target: No one else will be able to access it.

trans-unit.source: **Note** At least one enterprise must be selected in order to publish an app as line-of-business.
trans-unit.target: **Note** At least one enterprise must be selected in order to publish an app as line-of-business.

trans-unit.source: Organizational licensing
trans-unit.target: Organizational licensing

trans-unit.source: By default, the box for **Store-managed (online) volume licensing** is checked when you submit an app.
trans-unit.target: By default, the box for **Store-managed (online) volume licensing** is checked when you submit an app.

trans-unit.source: When publishing LOB apps, this box must be checked so that the enterprise can acquire your app in volume.
trans-unit.target: When publishing LOB apps, this box must be checked so that the enterprise can acquire your app in volume.

trans-unit.source: This won’t make the app available to anyone outside of the enterprise(s) that you selected in the **Distribution and visibility** section.
trans-unit.target: This won’t make the app available to anyone outside of the enterprise(s) that you selected in the **Distribution and visibility** section.

trans-unit.source: If you’d like to make the app available to the enterprise via disconnected (offline) licensing, you can check the **Disconnected (offline) licensing** box as well.
trans-unit.target: If you’d like to make the app available to the enterprise via disconnected (offline) licensing, you can check the **Disconnected (offline) licensing** box as well.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Organizational licensing options](organizational-licensing.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Organizational licensing options](organizational-licensing.md).

trans-unit.source: Enterprise deployment of LOB apps
trans-unit.target: Enterprise deployment of LOB apps

trans-unit.source: After you click **Submit to the Store**, the app will go through the certification process.
trans-unit.target: After you click **Submit to the Store**, the app will go through the certification process.

trans-unit.source: Once it’s ready, an admin for the enterprise must add it to their private store in the Windows Store for Business portal.
trans-unit.target: Once it’s ready, an admin for the enterprise must add it to their private store in the Windows Store for Business portal.

trans-unit.source: The enterprise can then deploy the app to its users.
trans-unit.target: The enterprise can then deploy the app to its users.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Working with line-of-business apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=698846) and [Distribute apps using your private store](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=698847).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Working with line-of-business apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=698846) and [Distribute apps using your private store](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=698847).

trans-unit.source: Updating LOB apps
trans-unit.target: Updating LOB apps

trans-unit.source: To publish updates to an app that you’ve already published as LOB, simply create a new submission.
trans-unit.target: To publish updates to an app that you’ve already published as LOB, simply create a new submission.

trans-unit.source: You can upload new packages or make any other changes, then click **Submit to the Store** to make the updated version available.
trans-unit.target: You can upload new packages or make any other changes, then click **Submit to the Store** to make the updated version available.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to keep the enterprise selections in **Distribution and visibility** the same (unless you intentionally want to change them, such as selecting an additional enterprise to acquire the app, or removing one of the enterprises to which you’d previously distributed it).
trans-unit.target: Be sure to keep the enterprise selections in **Distribution and visibility** the same (unless you intentionally want to change them, such as selecting an additional enterprise to acquire the app, or removing one of the enterprises to which you’d previously distributed it).

trans-unit.source: If you want to stop offering an app that you’ve previously published as line-of-business, and prevent any new acquisitions, you’ll need to create a new submission.
trans-unit.target: If you want to stop offering an app that you’ve previously published as line-of-business, and prevent any new acquisitions, you’ll need to create a new submission.

trans-unit.source: First, you’ll need to change your **Distribution and visibility** selection from **Line-of-business (LOB) distribution** to **Retail distribution**.
trans-unit.target: First, you’ll need to change your **Distribution and visibility** selection from **Line-of-business (LOB) distribution** to **Retail distribution**.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the **Distribution and visibility** options, choose **Hide this app and prevent acquisition**.
trans-unit.target: Then, in the **Distribution and visibility** options, choose **Hide this app and prevent acquisition**.

trans-unit.source: After the submission goes through the certification process, the app will no longer be available for new acquisitions (although anyone who already has it will continue to be able to use it).
trans-unit.target: After the submission goes through the certification process, the app will no longer be available for new acquisitions (although anyone who already has it will continue to be able to use it).

trans-unit.source: Distributing LOB apps through sideloading
trans-unit.target: Distributing LOB apps through sideloading

trans-unit.source: Making apps available through Store for Business ensures that the app has been signed by the Store and complies with the standard Store Policies.
trans-unit.target: Making apps available through Store for Business ensures that the app has been signed by the Store and complies with the standard Store Policies.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, companies may not want their LOB apps to be submitted through the Windows Dev Center for various reasons (such as compliance reasons or apps that need additional capabilities).
trans-unit.target: In some cases, companies may not want their LOB apps to be submitted through the Windows Dev Center for various reasons (such as compliance reasons or apps that need additional capabilities).

trans-unit.source: In this case, the enterprises can deploy apps directly to machines via sideloading, without using the Windows Store for Business.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the enterprises can deploy apps directly to machines via sideloading, without using the Windows Store for Business.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Sideload LOB apps in Windows 10](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=623433).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Sideload LOB apps in Windows 10](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=623433).
